title: Legal Updates on Janus Ruling and Agency Shop Provisions
summary: The newsletter discusses the implications of the Janus Court decision, which overrules the Abood v. Detroit Board of Education case, declaring agency shop provisions in collective bargaining agreements unconstitutional under First Amendment rights.
compressed_content: The Janus Court decision has significant implications for public employee unions and collective bargaining agreements. Agency shop provisions in CBAs are unconstitutional under First Amendment rights. RCW 41.56, which includes these provisions, was amended by House Bill 2751 but was struck down by the Supreme Court. Public employers are no longer required to subsidize unions or bargaining units. Unions may face challenges in excluding non-members from union activities.
